main event: An unidentified bright light was observed using ground radar and visually by witnesses in Detroit on September 8, 1959.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 5 minutes,The object moved in a straight line and then appeared to cross paths,No trail or exhaust was observed,The observer was using a telescope when the object passed in front of the moon,The report indicates that the sighting was prompted by recent publicity surrounding the moon shot.
witness description: the observer was a maintenance man for a concrete pipe company
